settings.heading: Immunity Building Oxymel
settings.text:
Fire Cider is a Fall/Winter staple in our herbal medicine cabinet. We take it at the first signs of a cold (a scratchy throat or cough), anytime we feel run down or cold, or as a immune-boosting supplement.

An oxymel is an elixir of herbs infused in vinegar and honey. A Fire Cider Oxymel is simply fire cider with honey added. You can make a regular fire cider, but adding honey often balances the intensity of the acid (apple cider vinegar) and goes down a lot smoother. It can also be used as a salad dressing or marinade!

settings.custom-liquid: <center><iframe width="320" height="522" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gyZejX30-5E" title="Fire Cider Oxymel" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe></center>

settings.heading: Ingredients
settings.description:
2-3 C Apple Cider Vinegar (with the "Mother")
1 C Honey
Garlic Cloves
Ginger/Turmeric Root
Horseradish
Peppercorn
Jalapeno
Fruit (lemon, orange, cranberries)
Pantry Herbs (Rosemary, Thyme, Oregano)
Medicinal Herbs (Lavender, Nettle, Astragalus, Ashwaghandha, Reishi, Lion's Mane)

settings.heading: Instructions
settings.description:
Chop or Blend your ingredients.

In a dry, clean 32oz mason jar, fill to the top with your ingredients.

Add apple cider vinegar and honey in a 3:1 ratio (you can also choose a ratio of up to 1:1).Â 

Cover with parchment paper and then mason jar lid. The parchment paper will prevent corrosion of your lid.

Store for 3-6 weeks in a cool, dark place (like a kitchen cabinet or pantry closet).

Strain and use this immunity building oxymel when feeling under the weather (1-2 tbsp), daily when sick, as salad dressing, or as a marinade,
